但是科比·布莱恩特（Kobe Bryant，1978年8月23日——2020年1月26日），美国职业篮球运动员，司职得分后卫。自1996年起效力于NBA洛杉矶湖人队，是前NBA篮球运动员乔·布莱恩特的儿子。

科比是NBA第一个高中生后卫，帮助洛杉矶湖人队拿下5次NBA总冠军，是NBA史上最年轻的30000分先生。2次成为NBA得分王，2次NBA总决赛MVP，1次NBA年度MVP，连续15次入选NBA全明星赛，2枚奥运会金牌，于2014年11月12日加冕历史第一“打铁王”。2014年12月15日，科比职业生涯总得分超越迈克尔·乔丹，升至历史第三位。2016年4月14日，科比NBA生涯告别战——主场对决爵士后，正式退役。2017年12月19日，斯台普斯球馆举行了科比的球衣退役仪式。

2018年3月5日，科比·布莱恩特的退役短片《亲爱的篮球》摘得第90届奥斯卡“最佳动画短片奖”。10月31日，科比·布莱恩特成为2019年国际篮联篮球世界杯全球大使。2019年6月20日，科比第四个女儿出生，取名Capri Kobe Bryant。

2020年1月26日，科比在卡拉巴萨斯因直升机坠毁而遇难，享年41岁；当地时间2月7日科比·布莱恩特的遗体安葬，家人为他举行了私人葬礼。​

猫

从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了
。

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Overwatch 1 for what it was at the time was a wonderful game and that sentiment still stands for Overwatch 2. As a FPS, multiplayer, free to play game it is on par with all other FPS games in the sphere. Overwatch has a wonderful and vast lineup of characters with deep lore, great designs, and cool kits. It also has beautiful and interesting map designs that are both nice to look at and fun to play on. Which, for me, are both important. Even when I find myself burned out on most games, Overwatch is still an appealing option to me, I have fun and enjoy myself playing the game both solo and with other people. Not to say I don't sometimes babyrage. Overall, I love the game.

But I can't write a review and not address the fact that only 17% of all reviews right now are positive.

[h1] Why are people upset? [/h1]

The Original idea behind Overwatch 2 was that it would be a [b] paid [/b] PVE standalone game that would run alongside Overwatch 1, that's clearly not what happened. I never had much stake on the PVE campaign, so admittedly, I don't hold the same levels of emotion as many members of the community do. That doesn't mean I'm blind and incapable of seeing that it was a bad move on Blizzards end, and it is so clear that with the Free to Play launch last year, they already knew they had plans to axe the PVE side of things, and I think it is shitty that management withheld that information for so long. 

This basically means that Overwatch 2 was just a free to play relaunch and as most free to play games do, Overwatch shifted it's monetization scheme. Overwatch 1 featured earnable lootboxes which you could open for random cosmetics, you could also purchase more lootboxes with real money but the game gave you enough boxes that paying for more was unnecessary. Overwatch 2 now features a Cash Shop with high prices and a seasonal Battle pass for 10 dollars. Going from OW1 to OW2 this change bites, it makes you feel like you're not being rewarded for playing anymore but this is not an issue unique to Overwatch, this is an issue that plagues most games, free or not. 

Another issue I've seen brought up is that new players have to unlock heros and that because there are bundles in the shop to unlock all of the heros the game is now "Pay to Win" and it ruins competitive integrity. This is a bit harder to speak on because I don't have a new account and I haven't had to experience unlocking characters. I do know that all characters released in the BP are free and are banned from competitive modes for 2 weeks on launch of said character, they are unlockable for free in following seasons as well. As for competitive integrity? No one is forcing anyone to jump into competitive with half the hero roster. I personally haven't played a competitive game where this was an actual issue. While, I objectively, don't agree with this change, it is also just clearly a tactic to get more money, could stunt the ability for new players to get into the game and I think it was unnecessary to add. 

The last thing I've seen mentioned in reviews isn't about Overwatch 2 as a game but about Blizzard. The Sexual Harassment that is going on in gaming companies is disgusting. Yet once again not a unique issue to Blizzard. Blizzard's has just been the most public. It is so frustrating to watch people uproar about Blizzard but ignore the allegations and lawsuits on-going at other companies. This is an issue in almost EVERY large gaming company and all of them should be held accountable for the depravity that they allowed or ignored in the workplace. Please don't be silent about the sexual harassment/allegations plaguing Riot Games and Ubisoft as well. It's important to stand up against all offenders. 

False promises, Free to play monetization schemes, unlockable heros, and the sexual harassment in large companies are all valid complaints, things I myself have an issue with, but are plaguing the Gaming Space in general. We should be mad at the way we're being treated by these companies. This predatory behavior adopted by so many companies. I don't expect to see actual change in the gaming space for a long time since it seems people only pick and choose when to be upset about issues that plague it.

I would be lying if I said I didn't like Overwatch, this used to be my number one shooter. I think Blizzard has really squandered what they had going here when they turned a pretty casual experience into an esport, and then again into a microtransaction filled sequel, that really was just an update that made the game worse in most ways.   

This is going to be a pretty mixed recommendation, The gameplay in Overwatch 2 is still decent but with blizzards character reworks and whiplash balance patches you never know how stable your experience is going to be. One of the biggest draws of the game, the tons of cosmetics feel mostly pay walled in Overwatch 2, and the prices can get pretty egregious.  

If you can handle battlepass grind and microtransactions I still think the gameplay is probably the best when it comes to the genre, I would be hard pressed to name a better hero shooter.  I feel like most of the criticisms I see about Overwatch aren't even aimed at the gameplay as much as they are plainly about blizzards active enshitification of an IP that was once globally relevant, and widely popular.
